Detailed Description

Contains all logic for distance calculation and index selection.

The PositionChecker is triggered by the robot's ground truth position data messages. Therefore, the frequency of the PositionChecker is dependent on the topic frequency!

Definition at line 22 of file position_checker.py.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ __init__()

def src.position_checker.PositionChecker.__init__ (   self,
  light_positions,
  odom_topic,
*  distance_threshold = 100,
  max_lights = 20,
  callbacks = [] 
)

PositionChecker constructor.

Initializes the subscriber and callbacks. Also compiles the numba accelerated index selection function.

Parameters
light_positionsArray of light positions. Array should be of dimensions np.ndarray(x,2). The rows are x and y coordinate of the lights respectively.
odom_topicThe ROS topic that the robot's odometry is published at.
distance_thresholdMaximum light rendering distance in meters. Default 100.
max_lightsMaximum amount of lights chosen at the same time.
callbacksList of callbacks to execute when finishing an index selection.
Note
Numba compilation might take some time. For more information, see __check_lights_boost.

Definition at line 29 of file position_checker.py.

Member Function Documentation

◆ __check_lights_boost()

def src.position_checker.PositionChecker.__check_lights_boost (   light_positions,
  position,
  distance_threshold,
  max_lights 
)
private

Numba accelerated indices selection function.

Calculates the distance from the robot to all lights. If more than max_lights are found to be within the threshold, orders the lights and selects the max_lights closest ones. If not, selects all lights within the threshold.

Parameters
light_positionsArray of light positions. Array should be of dimensions np.ndarray(x,2). The rows are x and y coordinate of the lights respectively.
positionCurrent robot position. Should be of type np.ndarray(2,).
distance_thresholdMaximum light rendering distance in meters.
max_lightsMaximum amount of lights chosen at the same time.
Returns
The indices of lights within the FoV, restricted by the maximum number of lights. If less than max_lights are found, array contains -1 integers for unused array slots. Required because numba works best with constant return size.

Definition at line 78 of file position_checker.py.

◆ __init_numba_jit()

def src.position_checker.PositionChecker.__init_numba_jit (   self)
private

Numba compile on object initialization function.

Calls the __check_lights_boost function once with dummy values to trigger numba jit compilation. Numba jit instead of ahead of time compilation was chosen to enable CPU architecture specific optimizations.

Definition at line 104 of file position_checker.py.

◆ _odometry_callback()

def src.position_checker.PositionChecker._odometry_callback (   self,
  odom 
)
private

Callback for the ground truth position subscriber.

Acts as a wrapper to __check_lights_boost. Extracts the position from the odometry data and calls the compiled function. Executes all callbacks with the array of active lights indices on completion.

Parameters
odomGround truth odometry data from the subscriber.

Definition at line 60 of file position_checker.py.

◆ start()

def src.position_checker.PositionChecker.start (   self)

Starts the PositionChecker.

Sets the ground truth position callback lock flag. Callback is locked during initialization to avoid startup errors.
